intro: Oncostylis junciformis var. speciosior, commonly known as the showy rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and rushes. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, preferring moist soils. Its ornamental value comes from its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in waterlogged conditions.
